Description: Six joining sherds of rim and shoulder of Aeolian grey ware pottery dinos; inscribed: "...the Mytilenaean dedicated me to (Aphrodite)". Red p[aint on inside of rim.
Curator's comments: According to Gardner (1888 p. 47), the dinos likely originated from Mytilene or Lesbos because inscription on sherd is a dedication made by a Mytilenean. Gardner (1888, p. 47, pl. XXI no. 791) also mentions that the sherd was excavated in the Sanctuary of Aphrodite. British Museum 1888,0601.624 belongs to the same piece. The sherd was analysed with NAA by Hans Mommsen (Bonn) and the fabric (sample NAUK 62) was determined to belong to group B-Troy. the origin of the fabric has been determined as from the region of the Troad.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 65, nos 788-789, 792, pl. XXI, nos 788-789, 792)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p.259, no.1)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (pp. 685-686, nos. 439 and 443)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 58, fig. 11, Table 1)
Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no.0 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.041)
